ygData.subject: Re: Here's a clip from the elite Innoruuk guild.
ygData.msgSnippet: ... No, my take was right.  If anyone on our server wants us to not kill a dragon when it spawns, all they have to do is send our guild leader a tell saying
ygData.messageBody:
> I think his gripe was that your guild doesn't leave any
> dragons alive long enough for others to kill them. Dunno if
> that's actually the case. But sharing means sharing with
> others who want what you're sharing, not just sharing with
> your friends.

No, my take was right. If anyone on our server wants us to not
kill a dragon when it spawns, all they have to do is send our guild leader
a tell saying "we'd like a chance to kill the next Vox spawn" and we have
always replied "sure" and given them plenty of time (usually 2 or 3 days).

> What I've seen done is for the multi-guild coordinated party
> to take over the /ooc or /auction channel and use that for
> coordination in lieu of /guildsay. (/shout too, but that can
> get annoying for others in the zone.)

It's not the actual fight co-ordination. It's getting another guild to
get the right people to the right place at the right time. It's already a
pain in the neck to get everyone in our guild to show up, to have to
worry about another guild too is turning a 2 hour Vox trip to a 6 hour Vox
trip. Plus, we can get 24 people to show up in Sol B in an hours notice.
We can't do that if there's another guild involved.

Miriana
